thread.title: Queen Elizabeth's Sapphire Jubilee: Her Majesty makes history as first British monarch to reach 65 years on the throne
thread.title_full: Queen Elizabeth's Sapphire Jubilee: Her Majesty makes history as first British monarch to reach 65 years on the throne

author: Mark Chandler
title: Queen Elizabeth's Sapphire Jubilee: Her Majesty makes history as first British monarch to reach 65 years on the throne
text:
05   Landmark achievement: Her Majesty the Queen Bethany Clarke/Getty Images 
The Queen makes history on Monday by becoming the first British monarch to reach their Sapphire Jubilee. 
February 6 marks 65 years since Elizabeth II's accession to the throne, but there are no grand festivities planned to mark Her Majesty's milestone. 
The Queen is not due to be out and about on official engagements on the landmark day. 
As is usual on Accession Day, she will be spending it privately at her Sandringham Estate in Norfolk . 
She was in good spirits on Sunday as she greeted well-wishers after attending a church service at St Peter and St Paul in West Newton, Norfolk. Queen Elizabeth II - Her Coronation Year Queen Elizabeth II - Her Coronation Year 1/17 Pomp and ceremony 
The Queen during her lavish coronation in 1953 ITV/Rex 
The Queen was 25 years old when she ascended to the Crown ITV/Rex 3/17 National celebrations 
Pipe Major Sardar Khan of the band of the 1st Punjab Regiment outside the Criterion BBC Studios where the band recorded a broadcast for the coronation of the new Queen Getty Images 4/17 Exclusive guestlist 
Westminster Abbey was opened at 6am on the day of the coronation to allow the 8,000 guests to take their places. Those present included foreign royalty, UK Lords, heads of state, and MPs from the Queen's various legislatures ITV/Rex 5/17 Route from the Palace 
The Queen proceeded through London from Buckingham Palace, through Trafalgar Square, and towards Westminster Abbey in the 'Gold State Coach' ITV/Rex 
The Queen seen during her Coronation tour in October 1953 Daily Mail 7/17 Head of State 
The Queen inspects guard of Highland Light Infantrymen at Hampden Park, Glasgow, during her Coronation visit to Scotland in 1953 8/17 Party time 
Children with party hats and blowing trumpets at a street party in Morpeth Street, in London's East End, to celebrate the coronation Getty Images 9/17 Royal couple 
The Queen wears the Imperial State Crown as she and the Duke of Edinburgh - dressed in the uniform of Admiral of the Fleet - wave from the balcony of Buckingham Palace to the crowds 10/17 Coronation fever 
Children in the East End of London reading a poster announcing a forthcoming party to celebrate the coronation Hulton Deutsch Collection/Corbis 11/17 Long May She Reign 
As the Queen drove down the Old Kent Road she was presented with a bouquet by Mary Milledge aged 5 Daily Mail 
The Queen seen smiling from the carriage after her coronation ceremony in Westminster Abbey 13/17 Display of power 
The Queen made her Coronation Review of the greatest display of Britain's air power ever assembled, at Oldiham Airfield, Hampshire. Nearly 1.000 planes and 4,000 officers, airmen and airwomen took part, including representatives of the Commonwealth. The programme included a fly past of 639 aircraft which had taken off from 42 different airfields. Among the planes were many of the latest jets 14/17 Procession 
The royal carriage passes along Victoria Embankment on its way to Westminster Abbey AFP/Getty Images 
Undated official portrait of the Queen shortly after her coronation AFP/Getty Images 16/17 Meeting the stars 
The Queen shakes hands with Brian Donlevy, Valentina Cortesa, Peter Finch, Mona Freeman and Stewart Granger at the 'Beau Brummell' film premiere at the Empire Theatre, London, on November 15, 1954 Harry Myers/Rex 17/17 Coronation tour 
The State Banquet in Canberra, Australia, in February 1954. The Queen is wearing a mimosa gold tulle dress patterned with an Australian wattle plant motif in gold, by English designer Norman Hartnell Getty Images 
Three-year-old Jessica Atfield, who dressed for the occasion in a union flag skirt, was delighted when she handed a bunch of flowers to the Queen. William, Kate and Harry join London Marathon training session 
The Queen, who missed church over Christmas due to a heavy cold, will undoubtedly be matter of fact about the historic occasion. 
In 2015, when she thanked the nation for the kind messages after overtaking Queen Victoria to become the longest-reigning monarch in British history, she admitted bluntly that the royal record was "not one to which I have ever aspired". 
She added: "Inevitably, a long life can pass by many milestones. My own is no exception." 
The Queen celebrated her 90th birthday last year and had a busy schedule commemorating the occasion, with a walkabout, beacon lighting and a black tie dinner for family and friends in Windsor on her actual birthday. 
A weekend of national celebrations, including a party on The Mall, was held for her official birthday in June. 
It is likely that any large-scale jubilee celebrations will be reserved for the Platinum Jubilee in 2022 - although any events will take into account the fact that Queen is due to turn 96 that year. 
The Duke of Cambridge is about to become a full-time royal this summer and will increase his official duties on behalf of the Queen. Fashioning a Reign: 90 Years of Style from The Queen's Wardrobe Fashioning a Reign: 90 Years of Style from The Queen's Wardrobe 1/10 
Royal Collection staff member Roxy Gilhooley arranges pantomime outfits worn in the 1943 production of Aladdin, Steve Parsons/ PA 2/10 
Curator Caroline de Guitaut arranges an evening gown worn by The Queen, in the Green Drawing Room Steve Parsons/PA 3/10 
A member of staff from the Royal Collection walks past a selection of hats worn by The Queen, Steve Parsons/PA 
Royal Collection staff member Roxy Gilhooley arranges an evening gown in the Crimson Drawing Room Steve Parsons/PA 5/10 
A member of staff from the Royal Collection arranges a white silk-crepe gown featuring 2,091 chiffon shamrocks worn by The Queen during the historic first State Visit to the Republic of Ireland in 2011 Steve Parsons/PA 6/10 
selection of hats worn by The Queen, during a press preview for Fashioning a Reign: 90 Years of Style from the Queen's Wardrobe, an exhibition at Windsor Castle in Berkshire Steve Parsons/PA 7/10 
urator Caroline de Guitaut arranges a selection of dresses worn by The Queen, in the State Dining Room Steve Parsons/PA 8/10 
A selection of hats worn by The Queen, during a press preview for Fashioning a Reign: 90 Years of Style from the Queen's Wardrobe, an exhibition at Windsor Castle in Berkshire. Steve Parsons/PA 9/10 
Curator Caroline de Guitaut arranges an evening gown worn by The Queen, in the Green Drawing Room Steve Parsons/PA 10/10 
Royal Collection staff member Roxy Gilhooley arranges a selection of dresses worn by The Queen, in the State Dining Room Steve Parsons/PA 
William and the Duchess of Cambridge are carrying out an engagement on Monday, but not to do with the Queen's record-breaking reign. Read more
